lead_paragraph: Connecticut will play its first game as a ranked team Saturday night against Rutgers, but many fans in Connecticut and New Jersey will be unable to watch. The game will be televised on ESPNU, which is not carried by Comcast, a cable provider with 1.4 million customers in New Jersey and 525,000 in Connecticut.Jeff Hathaway, the UConn athletic director, said he believed the network was using the game to leverage cable companies to add ESPNU. But Burke Magnus, the vice president and general manager of ESPNU, called that assertion “ridiculous.” He said the decision to put the game on ESPNU was made before UConn upset South Florida and jumped to No. 16. Magnus said talks with Comcast would continue.
